item.title: When Earnings Announcements Go After 4 PM
item.description: Introduction Decades ago, less than 15% of earnings announcements were released after 4 p.m. In these limited after-hour earnings releases, a significant portion was with bad news. Presumably, managers with bad news were taking advantage of the fact that far fewer traders are active in after-market hours (4 p.m. to 9:30 a.m.) compared to during trading hours, or that they are distracted by other issues (Patell and Wolfson, 1982 TAR).
